poem:
**Heatwave**

The sun, an unrelenting eye,  
Glares down upon our fragile shade.  
We seek refuge in draped shadows,  
Curtains drawn against the day's blaze.  
In the silence of night, we breathe,  
Inviting the whispers of cooler air.  
The world, a kiln, molds our patience—  
Yet still, we hope for the gentle rain.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Get a fan and shut curtains: how to keep your home cool in a heatwave Open windows (at the right time) It’s tempting to throw the windows open all day in the hope of a breeze, but when it is really hot outside, you only let in hotter air. Open the windows nice and wide overnight (if it is safe to do so) or early in the morning to let cooler air in, then shut". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
